geography.climate: Temperate with mysterious Rainbow Mist phenomenon
geography.terrain: Island with harbor town and prominent Rainbow Tower structure
notableFeatures: Rainbow Tower - massive structure dominating the island

population.demographics: Oppressed citizens subject to excessive taxation

keyEvents.title: Straw Hats Arrive at Ruluka
keyEvents.description: The Straw Hat Pirates dock at Ruluka Island after escaping from Marine pursuit.
keyEvents.significance: Introduces the main setting for the Ruluka Island Arc.

keyEvents.title: Discovery of Oppressive Taxation
keyEvents.description: The Straw Hats learn about the island's corrupt taxation system where citizens are charged for basic activities like walking and breathing.
keyEvents.significance: Establishes the corrupt governance and oppression that characterizes Ruluka Island.

keyEvents.title: Tarielishin Returns to Harbor
keyEvents.description: The mysterious ship Tarielishin drifts into Ruluka harbor unmanned, appearing exactly as it did fifty years ago.
keyEvents.significance: Provides evidence of the Rainbow Mist's time-distorting properties.

culturalSignificance: Ruluka Island is known for the Rainbow Mist legend and has become a place of scientific research due to Henzo's lifelong study of the phenomenon.

historicalEvents.description: Fifty years prior to the main timeline, Wetton attacked the town, forcing young Henzo and his friends to flee.
historicalEvents.significance: The attack that led to the Pumpkin Pirates' formation and subsequent tragedy

geography.terrain: Massive tower structure visible from great distances
notableFeatures: Imposing height dominating the island skyline
Built using funds from oppressive taxation

keyEvents.title: Rainbow Tower Sighting
keyEvents.description: Chopper and the crew notice the massive Rainbow Tower structure shortly after arriving on Ruluka Island.
keyEvents.significance: The tower serves as a visual symbol of the Mayor's corruption and the oppression of the island's citizens.

culturalSignificance: Symbol of governmental corruption and oppression. Citizens are taxed for even looking at it.
accessibility: Visible from most of the island; access controlled by authorities

geography.climate: Mysterious multicolored mist with anomalous properties
notableFeatures: Can trap people and ships for decades

notableResidents: Henzo's five friends (trapped for fifty years)
population.demographics: Various people lost over the years

keyEvents.title: Rainbow Mist Legend Revealed
keyEvents.description: Henzo and Robin discuss the Rainbow Mist legend, explaining its mysterious properties and the documented cases of disappearances.
keyEvents.significance: Establishes the Rainbow Mist as a legendary phenomenon with real, dangerous properties.

keyEvents.title: Entering the Rainbow Mist
keyEvents.description: Henzo takes the Going Merry and sails into the Rainbow Mist when it appears, seeking his lost friends.
keyEvents.significance: The mist becomes an active location that must be explored in subsequent episodes.

culturalSignificance: A legendary phenomenon that has claimed many ships and lives throughout history. Subject of myths, legends, and scientific research.
accessibility: Highly dangerous and unpredictable; appears sporadically

historicalEvents.description: Fifty years prior, five children on the Tarielishin sailed into the Rainbow Mist and vanished, trapped in a time-displaced state.
historicalEvents.significance: The central tragedy that drives the arc's plot and Henzo's quest

geography.region: Ruluka Island harbor (returned after fifty years)
notableFeatures: No crew aboard when it returned
Shows no signs of aging or deterioration
Original ship of the Pumpkin Pirates

population.demographics: Formerly carried the Pumpkin Pirates crew

keyEvents.title: Tarielishin's Mysterious Return
keyEvents.description: The Tarielishin drifts into Ruluka harbor unmanned, appearing exactly as it did fifty years ago when it disappeared into the Rainbow Mist. Henzo recognizes it immediately.
keyEvents.significance: Provides physical evidence of the Rainbow Mist's time-preservation properties and gives Henzo hope that his friends might still be alive.

culturalSignificance: The ship serves as a tangible connection between past and present, proof of the Rainbow Mist's anomalous effects on time.

historicalEvents.description: Fifty years prior, the Tarielishin carried five children into the Rainbow Mist where it and its crew vanished from normal time.
historicalEvents.significance: The ship's disappearance and preservation demonstrates the Rainbow Mist's time-distortion effects
